reviews.text:
Great station with 2 platforms - served by stations going between Swindon (and onto London) and on to Gloucester/Cheltenham - small waiting shelter
Ticket machine and boards telling when the next train is due

Ticket office in car park on platform 2 - it is clearly marked which platform to use

Easily accessible for Stonehouse but a bit of a way out but not much

Access for disabled may be by the road way - there is a bridge otherwise

Train operator is Great Western Railway

If using a new long IET - new Intercity trains that is more than 5 cars long - not all of the train will fit onto the platform - locals will know this and it is not clear at the preceding station and it is not always announced on the train either - so if any queries then check before getting off as I did - important as I had a bike!!
Very small station, but convenient if you want to meet someone who's driving up the m5. No facilities here so make sure they are waiting for you!

Ticket machine doesn't take cash. Not everyone chooses to pay by card (or indeed can do so, what about teenagers old enough to travel alone but too young to have a card?) Puts people in a difficult position, with fear of getting fined for boarding without a ticket.
